title:
Installation of renewable capacities to meet emission targets and demand
  under uncertainty
authors: Nacira Agram, Fred Espen Benth, Giulia Pucci
abstract:
This paper focuses on minimizing the costs related to renewable energy
installations under emission constraints. We tackle the problem in three
different cases. Assuming intervening once, we determine the optimal time to
install and the optimal capacity expansions under uncertainty. By assuming the
possibility of two or multiple interventions, we find that the optimal strategy
is to intervene only once. We also prove that there are instances where
capacity expansions should be delayed.
